description: watch for file changes and trigger plugins automatically
option-use-config-description: Specify plugin configurations in format: <plugin-name>[::<watch-path1>...]. Examples: 'CreateRestEndpointPlugin' or 'CreateRestEndpointPlugin::**/apps/*.yaml::**/dialogs/**/*.yaml'
info-running: Magnolia CLI is running in watch mode.
info-use-config-example:
Example of watch mode setup using '--use-config' option:
`npm run mgnl -- watch-mode --use-config "CreateRestEndpointPlugin" "CreateModelPlugin::**/dialogs/**/*.yaml"`
info-using-default-paths: All specified paths for {{pluginName}} were excluded. Using default watch paths instead.
warn-plugin-not-found-config: Plugin {{pluginName}} not found in available plugins. Check plugin name spelling or ensure the plugin is installed and available.
warn-plugin-not-found-use-config: Plugin {{pluginName}} not found in available plugins. Check plugin name spelling, ensure the plugin is installed, or verify you're using '::' (not ':') to separate plugin name from paths.
warn-invalid-watchpaths: Invalid watchPaths for plugin "{{pluginName}}". Ensure the paths are correct and exist in the project.
warn-excluded-path-specified: Path '{{path}}' for plugin {{pluginName}} matches excluded patterns and will be ignored.
error-no-mgnl-config: The config file "mgnl.config.js" was not found. Create the file or jumpstart a project using: `npx mgnl jumpstart`.
error-no-valid-configuration: No valid configuration found for watch mode. Check any warnings above.
error-no-config-found: No watch mode configuration found in mgnl.config.js and no --use-config provided.
error-plugin-no-start-method: Plugin {{pluginName}} does not have a start method.
error-plugin-unknown-error: [{{pluginName}}]: Failed to run plugin with unknown error.
